subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Any eBay sellers willing to do this?
author: Marlboro63@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1207607625
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Hi Kay,
 
I agree with you.  This guy puts a ghost sticker over the Radio Shack  name 
and nobody knows. I think if we do the add on Ebay and put the links on  there 
as well as the hacking instruction as well as the yahoo groups like we  would 
all further ourselves.  I just didn't do it because I did not want to  offend 
anyone on here by doing it without letting everyone know first.  I  have given 
away (4) radio's away so far to very deserving individuals who could  not get 
them.  But it still would be nice to let it be known that we are  out there.  
We are not a WATCHDOG group but still do not like to see people  taken 
advantage of for their not knowing.
 
Jeff
 
 
In a message dated 4/7/2008 5:28:09 P.M. Central Daylight Time,  
psfponies@... writes:

 
 
 
Sorry Jeff I do remember you offering that. I think its a good idea 
to  let people know if they are really interested in one they can get 
one at  radio shack and hack their own. Since it was your idea if you 
want to you  can list it or I will. I just hate to see people paying 
$100 for  one.

Kay

--- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) ,  
Marlboro63@.,  Mar
>
> Hi Kay,
> 
> That was  what I posted on my original idea over a week ago and I 
was blasted  
> about it especially that I would look like a fool that I was  
willing to take 
> a loss of a few bucks. But atleast the hacking  information and 
links would 
> have been posted on ebay for all to  see.
> 
> Jeff
> 
> 
> In a message dated  4/7/2008 4:58:03 P.M. Central Daylight Time, 
> psfponies@.. psfponies@..
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I checked to see what it  would cost to sell one of ebay. To list 
it 
> it is $1.00 for  $25.00-449.00 plus 8.75% of the initial $25.00 
> ($2.19), plus 3.50% of  the remaining closing value balance 
($25.01 
> to $1,000.00)
>  
> 
> I would be willing to list the one I have plus give the  
information 
> on the free hacking and that fact that you can get  one at Radio 
> Shack for $24.99 just to shut this guy down. At the most  I would 
be 
> out $1.00 to not sell it!!!! Well worth it I'd  say.
> 
> Can someone send me the written instructions on how to  hack the 
12-
> 249.
> 
> Kay
> 
> --- In  _EVP-ITC@yahoogroup --- In  _EVP-IT
_ITC@..._ (mailto:ITC@yahoogroups.com) ) , "LC  
> Duplatt" <lcdupla@> wrote:
> >
> > Either  that, or anyone willing to make them for $25 + shipping 
> with 
>  > no profit? You could then list them just like the ones that are 
>  > selling...so they pull up identical to the listings that are up 
>  > there. :)
> > 
> > LC
> > 
> > --- In  _EVP-ITC@yahoogroup --- In  _EVP-IT
_ITC@..._ (mailto:ITC@yahoogroups.com) ) , 
>  "itcdeadpeople" <ITCdeadpeople@> 
> > wrote:
> >  >
> > > I was thinking if someone would list a FREE DOWNLOAD of  
> > instructions for the various hacks 
> > > on the  Radio Shack units, it could put an end to the business 
> for 
>  > sellers that are taking 
> > > advantage of people who are  unaware that they could probably 
> hack 
> > the units for  
> > > themselves. 
> > > 
> > > I have  seen "downloads" of various things listed before. Why 
> not 
>  > this?
> > > 
> > > Margaret
> >  >
> >
> 
> 
>
